ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Kodaikanal Society for the Protection and Care for Animals(KSPCA) is a registered AWO/NGO and recognized by the Animal Welfare Board of India.The year 2016 marks as the 40th year of recognition of the organization. The Objective of the organization is the prevention and suppression of cruel and improper treatment of animals and the amelioration of their condition throughout Kodaikanal and other parts of the district. KSPCA was estimated to be founded in the 1930s as the Kodaikanal Society for Prevention of Cruelty to Animals. However, and due to requirement that there can be only one Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals per district we had a name change to the Kodaikanal Society for the Protection and Care for Animals(KSPCA). Our goal and vision has always been the same and we are one of the oldest organizations in the country. KSPCA has been honored and given membership in FIAPO this year for the work we have done. Our projects have been the rescue of domestic animals and wildlife in emergencies.We also participate in disaster management and rescue (the 2015 Chennai floods  Chennai animal rescue (CAR), forest fires). We provide on the spot emergency treatments , ABC(Animal birth control), medical camps for animals, fostering and adoptions, street dog feeding, outreach programs in schools and for public on waste management, outreach program on compassion animal welfare, man animal conflict, conservation and protection of Fauna and Flora in and across the state. We have been focusing on the man-animal conflict issues and regularly visit villages along with the forest department. Alongside schools and colleges we promote local indigenous varieties to be planted in and around Kodaikanal and also do clean ups around forest and river areas .Our focus has been to do wildlife rescues when needed; we have also worked with captive private elephants lately. The case of Lakshmi, the private elephant from Palani is handled by KSPCA along with the support of WRRC and WNCT.We are the only organization that has successfully rescued a camel during bakrid sept2015.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Actively involved in formation, support and cultivation of saving habits to more than 500 Self Help groups, more than 100 children parliaments, 15 farmers clubs and differently abled persons groups in 15 unions of Ariyalur, Thanjavur and Thiruvarur districts of Tamilnadu. Conducting more than 750 awareness programs every year in the form of cultural programs, exhibitions, rallies, seminars on Gender, Women development , awareness on girl child, AIDS awareness, organic farming, (vermi compost, pipe compost, natural pesticides, panchakaviyam, etc,) herbal plantation, tree plantation, global warming, plastic awareness, protection of natural resources, gramasabha participation, waste management, health awareness, kitchen gardens, fundamental rights, RTI, RTF, RTE, prevention and rehabilitation of differently abled persons. Formation and functioning of CBOs in areas of operation. Trainings conducted on computers, tailoring, coir making, Entrepreneur Development Program training, etc. Nearly 30 free evening study centres for the poor children in Thanjavur and Ariyalur districts. Provide career guidance and conducted summer camps where spoken english and computer skills are taught to the youngsters. Provide livelihood opportunities like dairy farming, coconut leaf knitting, coir making, petty shops, tailoring, hollow block making, flower, dry fish, vegetables, sarees and garments sales. Support the community in the operational area to avail Government schemes like Old Age Pension (OAP), Widow pension, disabled pension, marriage assistance, pregnancy support, house patta, building of personal toilets, housing schemes. Celebration of Samathuva Pongal, World Womens Day, Domestic Violence Day, Childrens Day, World Disabled Day every year. Conduct medical camps (general and eye) for the village community. Provide loan facilities of more than Rs. 10 Lakhs every year through banks and other financial institutions for education, skill development, house repair and income generation programs. Provide educational assistance to the underpreviliged youngsters. Provide assistance in the form of relief and rehabilitation in case of disasters like floods and fire. More than 1000 persons are capacitated every year through non-formal trainings and education and have successfully gained better employment. Provided alcohol awareness to more than 5000 participants through skits, plays, documentaries, pictures, photos, posters and charts. Conduct meetings, counselling and rehabilitation support to more than 1000 addicts in our operational area.

ngoList.title: M S Swaminathan Research Foundation
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: MS Swaminathan Research Foundation (MSSRF) was established in the year 1988 as a non-profit Trust and recognized by the Department of Industrial and Scientific Research, Government of India. The vision of MSSRF is to link science and society for sustainable and equitable development and the mission is to develop and demonstrate models for large scale replication and policy influencing following a pro-poor, pro-nature and pro-women approach and the principles of anticipatory and participatory research. The MSSRF is working on six thematic areas namely, i) Coastal Systems Research, ii) Biodiversity, iii) Biotechnology, iv) Ecotechnology, v) Food security and vi) Information, Education and Communication. Coastal Systems Research Programme aims at integrating ecological security of coastal areas and the livelihood security of coastal communities, in a mutually reinforcing manner, to achieve sustainable management of coastal resources. Community centred mangrove wetlandrestoration and conservation is the major focus of this programme. Apart from these, this programme also concentrates on integrated coastal zone management, enhancing adaptive capacity of local community to sea level rise and carbon dynamics in coastal environment. Biodiversity programme is to optimize conservation and livelihood benefits of the poor who live in the biodiversity hotspots of the Indian peninsular region. Community agro biodiversity -a vital source for livelihood sustenance to a majority of the poor, particularly the tribal communities, and Rare, Endemic and Threatened (RET) plant diversity, including the medicinal plants are the priority areas of action. Biotechnology programme is based on the societal needs and takes adequate care in blending the conventional technologies with advanced state of art technology in the field of biotechnology research. The focus is on molecular mapping and studying phylogenetic relationships among the mangrove species to gain an insight into intra and inters populations and species diversity. Currently, work is going to develop salt and drought tolerant paddy varieties using genes from mangroves and Prosopis juliflora. Ecotechnology Porgramme undertakespioneering R&D activities to diffuse environmentally sound technologies through innovative delivery mechanisms, by an inclusive and a process oriented approach for sustainable livelihoods at the grass root level. The Centre promotes sustainable agricultural practices by enhancing input use efficiency - particularly water and nutrients, pest management and farming systems - to improve total factor productivity as well as to conserve natural resources. Food Security Programme focuses on research, field action training and advocacy. Studies are done on the state of food insecurity in rural and urban India and are undertaken by the Centre and reports are published periodically.Under the Community Food Security Systems, models of Community foodgrain banks are in operation in tribal pockets in Orissa and Tamil Nadu. Pilot initiatives to increase food availability through Community Food grain Banks while the Community-managed nutrition security model isfocusing on infant and young child feeding practices and is being piloted in three villages in Koraput district of Orissa. Information, Education and Communication Programme implements Village Resource Centres (VRCs) and Village Knowledge Centres (VKCs). This Centreconnects several data generators and data providers focusing primarily on content and capacity building(universities, experts, financial institutions, corporate sector, technocrats, grassroots academicians, etc.) to community and grass roots organizations.In partnership several national and internationalorganizations, MSSRF initiated steps to extend the VKC concept to different parts of the country by creatingmulti-stake holder partnership called Mission 2007: Every Village a Knowledge Centre.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Madras School of Economics (MSE) was founded in 1993 as a (largely) privately funded independent institution of higher learning in social sciences. Several eminent economists of India including late Dr. Raja J. Chelliah, Dr. C. Rangarajan, Dr. Kaushik Basu, Dr. Montek Singh Ahluwalia and Dr. U. Sankar have provided support in establishing the School. The Madras School of Economics is a specialized institution in Economics, focusing on Public Finance, Finance, Macro-modeling, Environment, Trade, Development, Insurance, and Industry. In addition to academic research, the MSE has been conducting policy oriented research works with support from several Ministries of State and Central Governments. MSE has also carried out research projects funded by several national and international agencies including the World Bank, the World Resource Institute, the British High Commission, the Global Development Network, South Asian Network for Development and Environmental Economics, GIZ, the Reserve Bank of India, Indian Space Research Organization, Union Planning Commission, Tamil Nadu State Planning Commission, Finance Commission of India, Tamil Nadu State Finance Commission etc. So far MSE has successfully completed more than 110 research projects, and organized several training programs, workshops and conferences. The World Bank Aided Environmental Management Capacity Building Technical Assistance Project was implemented by the Ministry of Environment and Forests (MoEF) and executed by the Madras School of Economics (MSE), Chennai. Following the successful completion of this project, the MoEF has designated MSE as a Centre of Excellence (CoE) in Environmental Economics under its CoE Scheme. The CoE at MSE has completed first five years of its work on March 31, 2007. The Centre was set up on the basis of a MoU between the Ministry of Environment and Forests and the Madras School of Economics. The objectives of the Centre were to carry out research projects, operate a website, conduct training programmes and provide policy inputs to the Ministry. With funding given by the Ministry of Environment and Forests on project mode, the Centre has successfully completed first ten years of work in 2012. The support from the Ministry of Environment and Forests, Government of India has further been extended to additional five years  2012 to 2017. This note summarizes the work done at the CoE (EE) over the period April 2012 to April 2016.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Major Activities of MMSSS. Promoting empowerment programs for Arunthaiyar Women and Children in 60 Arunthathiyar packets of Theni district and thriving in equipping the Arunthathiyar women with required skill to enhance their socio-economic status. Child Line 1098  Project is in partnership with The Union Ministry for Women and Child Development (MWCD)  India. Under the Scheme of Integrated Child Care and Protection (ICPS), we have an established Sub-center at Aruppukottai, monitoring both Aruppukottai and KariyapattiBlocks of Virudhunagar District. Fostering and caring the child laborers without family supports, the children of broken families and the abandoned and runaway children through Reception cum Observation Home in Virudhunagar. Conducting Farmers Field School programme in 5 villages (S. Puliyampatti, Srirangapuram, Sirumalai, Kattayadevanpatti, Vadakavunchi, Periyapatti) in Virudhunagar district of Tamil Nadu, which aims to groom the small and marginal farmers to learn conventional and viable natural sources of agricultural practices for better productivity. Advancing Care Home Association of Madurai (CHAM) to rescue and rehabilitate destitute and abandoned women of its areas of 4 districts viz., Madurai, Dindigul, Virudhunagar and Theni. The association trains the domestic household women workers in increasing their domestic based technical and life skills. Promoting Kolping programs for women to enhance their social, economic and spiritual well-being. Running Kolping Computer Centre for women to gain knowledge and application skills in computer relevant courses for better job prospects. DB Tech -Skilling India as mission and with a clear vision of Bridge digital, social and economic divide in India by significantly contribute to the development of the marginalized youth by enhancing the employability and life management skills joined hands with Don Bosco Tech, also known as DB Tech, New Delhi. Archbishop Antony PappuSamy (AAPS)  IAS Academy -Facilitating the younger minds of the locality to be successful in the competitive exams thorough AAPS IAS Academy with the collaboration of Catholic Professors Association of Madurai Archdiocese. We impart, UPSC Exams: IAS, IPS, IFS; TNPSC Exams: Group 1,2,4; IBP (Bank Exams) & Clerical Exams; VAO Exams; NET, SET Exams.

Also conducted VTP (Vocational Training Program and employedtheThrough OPAM project supported the Dalits students for their education.

Empowering the Women of Arunthathiyar community of Theni district and make them self reliance financially and Educationally through which the total development of the Arunthathiyar Community. Through Kolping fund the Society had supported the poor Dalit people to have a safe and secure House to stay. through which build self confidence and self respect in the society where they live.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Educational activities for the children, esp. girl children living in stone quarries and brick kilns. School supportive services through enrollment camps, mainstreaming and educational assistances. Motivational camps, leadership camps and counseling activities for children esp. girl children. Career guidance camps, vocational training programs, job placements, referrals linkages for adolescent girls and senior girls. Gender development and educational workshops for senior girls and the mothers of those children living in difficult situations. Formation of self help groups and family units among the mothers of children in difficult circumstances and families living in stone quarries and brick kilns. Workshops in gender rights, government programs and schemes for the women living in stone quarries, brick kilns, tribal areas and forest areas. Activities focused on food safety and security among tribal families and remote rural families in Krishnagiri District. Environment protection and promotion education and workshops for the families in Kanchipuram and Krishnagiri Districts. Education on Prevention and Control of Global Warming among the youngsters, esp. among the school children. HIV/AIDS prevention and control education along with care and supportive activities to those infected and affected with the syndrome. Welfare and economic development activities for people differently able, esp. for the girl children and women. In all our activities we give priority to girl children and women, as we are the womens organization working with the special focus on women development
